trans-unit.source: Represents the `<tr>` HTML element in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable"></xref> control.
The `<tr>` element represents a row in a table.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class to programmatically control the `<tr>` HTML elements in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class allows you to customize the appearance of a row in a table by specifying the background color, the border color, and the height of the cells in the row.

These attributes are set using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BorderColor%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Height%2A> properties.

You can control the alignment of the contents in the cells for the entire row by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Align%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.VAlign%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Align%2A> property controls the horizontal alignment of the contents of the cells, while the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.VAlign%2A> property controls the vertical alignment.
By using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Cells%2A> collection of this class, you can programmatically access the individual cells in a row of a table.
This allows you to control the properties of each cell, as well as the content.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.
This constructor is used to create an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object that represents the `<tr>` element for a table row.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow>.
Property
Initial Value
The "tr" literal string.
Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Align%2A> property to specify the horizontal alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
Setting this property affects all cells in a row of a table represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.
To apply an alignment attribute to a single cell of a row, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell.Align%2A> property for that cell.
The following table lists the values that can be used for this property.
Value
Description
Aligns the contents of the cell with the left edge of the cell.
Aligns the contents of the cell in the middle of the cell.
Aligns the contents of the cell with the right edge of the cell.
You can also use `Justify` and `Char` as values for this property.
However, not all browsers support these features.
The horizontal alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable"></xref> control.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets or sets the background color of the row represented by an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref> class.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A> property to specify the background color of the row represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.
You can specify a color either by name or by using a hexadecimal value, preceded by the pound character (#), in the form #RRGGBB.
RR, GG, and BB represent hexadecimal values from 0 to 255 that indicate the red, green, and blue components of a color, respectively.
For example, the value #0000FF represents the color blue.
It specifies the minimum value (00) for the red and green components, while specifying the maximum value (FF) for the blue component.
The following table shows the sixteen predefined HTML color names and corresponding hexadecimal values that can be used for the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A> property.
For more information on HTML colors, see the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
Color name
Hexadecimal value
Aqua
#00FFFF
Black
Blue
Fuchsia
#FF00FF
Gray
Green
Lime
Maroon
Navy
Olive
Purple
Red
Silver
#C0C0C0
Teal
White
#FFFFFF
Yellow
#FFFF00
The available colors for use with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BgColor%2A> property can be determined from the <xref:System.Drawing.KnownColor> enumeration.
Color names are case-insensitive.
The background color of the row represented by an instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref>.
Gets or sets the border color of the row represented by an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref> class.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell.BorderColor%2A> property to specify the border color of the row represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.
You can specify a color either by name or by using a hexadecimal value, preceded by the pound character (#), in the form #RRGGBB.
RR, GG, and BB represent hexadecimal values from 0 to 255 that indicate the red, green, and blue components of a color, respectively.
For example, the value #0000FF represents the color blue.
It specifies the minimum value (00) for the red and green components, while specifying the maximum value (FF) for the blue component.
The following table shows the sixteen predefined HTML color names and corresponding hexadecimal values that can be used for the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BorderColor%2A> property.
For more information on HTML colors, see the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125).
Color name
Hexadecimal value
Aqua
#00FFFF
Black
Blue
Fuchsia
#FF00FF
Gray
Green
Lime
Maroon
Navy
Olive
Purple
Red
Silver
#C0C0C0
Teal
White
#FFFFFF
Yellow
#FFFF00
The available colors for use with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.BorderColor%2A> property can be determined from the <xref:System.Drawing.KnownColor> enumeration.
Color names are case-insensitive.
The border color of the row represented by an instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref>.

Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell"></xref> objects that represent the cells contained in a row of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Cells%2A> collection to programmatically access the cells of a row in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
You can programmatically add, remove, and insert cells in the collection.
If there are no cells defined in a row, an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCellCollection> object is returned.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCellCollection"></xref> that contains the cells of a row in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable"></xref> control.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.CreateControlCollection%2A> method creates a new <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> collection that is used to hold the row cells.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.CreateControlCollection%2A> method is primarily of interest to control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref> control's child server controls.
Gets or sets the height (in pixels) of the row represented by an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref> class.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Height%2A> property to specify the height (in pixels) of the cell represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.
All cells in the row share the same height.
If you specify a height that is smaller than is required to display the contents of the cells in the row of a table, this property is ignored.
The height (in pixels) of the row represented by an instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref>.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets or sets the content between the opening and closing tags of the control without automatically converting special characters to their equivalent HTML entities.
This property is not supported for this control.
Do not read from or assign a value to this property.
Otherwise, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException?displayProperty=fullName> exception is thrown.
This property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.
The content between the opening and closing tags of the control.
An attempt was made to read from or assign a value to this property.
Gets or sets the content between the opening and closing tags of the control with automatic conversion of special characters to their equivalent HTML entities.
This property is not supported for this control.
Do not read from or assign a value to this property.
Otherwise, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException?displayProperty=fullName> exception is raised.
This property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.
The content between the opening and closing tags of the control.
An attempt was made to read from or assign a value to this property.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref> control's child controls to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.RenderChildren%2A> method provides additional formatting before and after calling the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderChildren%2A> method.

The additional formatting makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control's rendered HTML easier to read by adding a line return and indenting before rendering the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control's child objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.RenderChildren%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object that receives the rendered content.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow"></xref> control's end tag.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.RenderEndTag%2A> method provides additional formatting after calling the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlContainerControl.RenderEndTag%2A> method.
The added formatting makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control's rendered HTML easier to read by adding a line return after the closing `<tr>` tag.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.RenderEndTag%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object that receives the rendered content.
Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.VAlign%2A> property to specify the vertical alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
Setting this property affects all cells in a row of a table represented by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> class.
To apply an alignment attribute to a single cell of a row, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell.VAlign%2A> property for that cell.
The following table lists the values that can be used for this property.
Value
Description
Aligns the contents of a cell with the upper edge of the cell.
Aligns the contents of a cell in the center of the cell.
Aligns the contents of a cell with the lower edge of the cell.
You can also use `BaseLine` as a value for this property.
However, not all browsers support this feature.
The vertical alignment of the content in the cells of a row in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable"></xref> control.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.
